General Notes: "Over the last several years, cities and other local agencies throughout California have transitioned from at-large elections to district-based elections, largely in response to claims their at-large system violated the California Voting Rights Act (“CVRA”). The CVRA prohibits using an at-large election system if doing so “impairs the ability of a protected class to elect candidates of its choice or its ability to influence the outcome of an elections ….” (Elec. Code, § 14027.) Since the law’s passage in 2002, at least 185 cities and nearly 400 other California jurisdictions have made the switch." - https://www.calcities.org/docs/default-source/city-attorneys/5.2023-spring-whatley-implementing-districts-now-that-you-have-gone-now-what.pdf?sfvrsn=45ffc414_3

Municipal-specific Notes: Mayor is elected at-large; CM elected by districts
CM do not appear to represent districts; therefore are likely "at-large"
